page.title: 10KING STERNDALE VILLAGE
page.content: The village has hardly changed since it was first established in the{13th {century.}Kingsterndale was once part of{the Royal Forest of the Peak}and its original name was Stony Dale. In the centre of the village is an old{Butter Cross.}It is called this because people came from all around to sell their produce and slaves. It was built for the coronation of Queen Elizebeth the first. There is a small church in Kingsterndale which was built in 1847. {About 12 people use the church each {Sunday. Kingsterndale is usually affected by the snow in winter. It has been known that in 1862 the village was cut off for 8 weeks. Most years it is only cut off for a couple of days. Kingsterndale is a beautiful village.
